trans-unit.source: Provides the design-time view that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control represents a data source that calls methods of a business object in order to perform the Delete, Insert, Select, and Update database-type operations.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control in a visual designer.

An <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView> object provides members that indicate whether various database-type operations can be performed and that return schema and design-time data.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanInsert%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanUpdate%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanDelete%2A> properties indicate whether the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control can perform the corresponding database-type operations.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property, which is always `true`, indicates that the associated control can sort rows.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanPage%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> properties, which are always `false`, indicate that the associated control cannot perform server paging and cannot return the total number of rows in a query, respectively.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> property gets a schema that describes the data source view that is represented by this view object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData%2A> method generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView> class when requested by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner.GetView%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> object that is associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control on the visual designer surface.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that owns this <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView"></xref> object.
A string containing the name of this <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView"></xref> object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform a Delete operation.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanDelete%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.DeleteMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").
`true` if the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> can perform a Delete operation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform an Insert operation.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanInsert%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.InsertMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").
`true` if the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> can perform an Insert operation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can perform server-based paging.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls cannot perform server-based paging.
Always `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can return the total number of rows that are returned by a query.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls cannot return result-set row counts.
Always `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control can sort rows.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property indicates that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> controls can sort result-set rows.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.SortParameterName%2A> property specifies the parameter in the collection that is referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.SelectParameters%2A> property that is used to define the sort expression.
Always `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the associated data source control as it is currently configured can perform an Update operation.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.CanUpdate%2A> property returns `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.UpdateMethod%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> control contains a value other than the empty string ("").
`true` if the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> can perform an Update operation; otherwise, `false`.
Generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData%2A> method provides a design-time version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> view for use by the associated data-bound control designer.
It is not expected that the designer will perform actual data access at design-time time.
Instead, the designer creates sample data that matches the schema of the data source.
An integer containing the minimum number of rows to retrieve.
A value indicating whether the data returned is sample data or real data.
A sample of the data represented by the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource"></xref> or `null` if the designer cannot generate any sample data.
Gets a schema that describes the data source view that is represented by this view object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> property gets the schema tables from the associated designer.

If any <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects are returned, the schema selects the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> with the same <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> property as this view object, or it selects the first <xref:System.Data.DataTable> if this view has no name.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDesignerDataSourceView.Schema%2A> then creates and returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema> object from the selected <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
This allows the designer of a data-bound control to provide relevant choices based on the design-time data source view that is selected for data binding.

An object implementing the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema"></xref> that describes the view and the properties of the objects in the list or `null` if the schema is unavailable.
